oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SGT Christopher Ammons resting near Ben Cat wearing a Viet Cong hat

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SGT Christopher Ammons rests in thick foliage near Ben Cat wearing a Viet-Cong hat. He is lying on the ground with his head on his pack, his rifle and other equipment nearby. A second soldier is behind him.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Military service; Uniforms
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Ben Cat (Vietnam); Viet-cong
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. His photographs show details of the daily life of soldiers in Vietnam. Ben Cat is a rural district of Binh Duong province in the Southeast region of Vietnam.
